content: irish hiking…hat ©nicole reeves 2005 for non-commercial use only this hat was designed to match the beautiful irish hiking scarf the scarf pattern can be found at http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/irish-hiking-scarf materials -us 8 double-pointed needles -one skein of worsted weight yarn i used patons classic wool in royal purple 223 yards per skein -stitch markers -cable needle -tapestry needle gauge 5 stitches and 6 row per inch hat circumference is approximately 22½ inches the height is approximately 8¼ inches with the ribbing turned up abbreviations used c6f cable slip 3 stitches on cable needle cn and hold in front knit next three stitches knit 3 stitches from cn k2tog= knit two together k=knit p=purl sm=slip marker pattern - cast on 112 stitches - k2 p2 28 times making sure to join for knitting in the round continue k2 p2 ribbing for 4 inches cable section set-up place stitch marker after every 14th stitch to mark areas for crown shaping decreases row 1 k2 p3 k6 p3 to end row2-7 knit the knit stitches and purl the purl stitches row 8 k2 p3 c6f p3 to end repeat row 1-8 until hat measures 8 inches from cast on row crown shaping note you will now end the cable pattern and begin knitting each round round 1 knit to two stitches before the marker k2tog sm to end of round 104 stitches remaining continue working each round in this way until 8 stitches remain cut yarn and with the tapestry needle weave end through remaining 8 stitches twice to close the crown weave in ends turn up 2 inches of the ribbed edging
